questions.question: What is the formula used to calculate the BET surface area for La-BTTc?
questions.answer: The BET surface area for La-BTTc is calculated using nitrogen gas sorption measurements at 77 K.

questions.question: What are the two steps observed in the thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) of La-BTTc?
questions.answer: The two steps observed in the TGA of La-BTTc are characterized as the release of water (up to 80 °C) and DMF (up to 250 °C), respectively.

questions.question: How does the structure of La-BTTc compare to that of MIL-103 in terms of the hexagonal pores?
questions.answer: In La-BTTc, the hexagon is somewhat flattened, whereas MIL-103 forms a regular hexagon.

questions.question: What method is used to evaluate the acidity of La-BTTc using acetone as a probe molecule?
questions.answer: The acidity of La-BTTc is evaluated by observing the low-frequency shift of n(C=O) in the IR spectrum when acetone interacts with acidic sites.

questions.question: What indicates the strong interaction between the LaIII in La-BTTc and the carbonyl oxygen atom of acetone?
questions.answer: The largest low-frequency shift of ca. 30 cm–1 in the IR spectrum of acetone-adsorbed La-BTTc indicates the strong interaction.

questions.question: Is the framework structure of La-BTTc maintained after exposure to NH3 at 350 °C?
questions.answer: Yes, the framework structure of La-BTTc is maintained even at 350 °C after exposure to NH3.

questions.question: Does La-BTTc show a desorption peak in the high temperature region during NH3-TPD?
questions.answer: Yes, La-BTTc shows a large desorption peak in the high temperature region during NH3-TPD.

questions.question: What reaction is used to test the Lewis acid catalysis of La-BTTc?
questions.answer: The cyanosilylation reaction of benzaldehyde with trimethylsilyl cyanide is used to test the Lewis acid catalysis of La-BTTc.

questions.question: How does the catalytic activity of La-BTTc in the cyanosilylation reaction compare to previous results for PCPs?
questions.answer: The observed catalytic activity of La-BTTc is comparable to the best prior results for PCPs, reflecting its strong acidity.

questions.question: Is the reaction of 1-hexene with La-BTTc at 400 °C indicative of cracking reaction capabilities similar to zeolites?
questions.answer: Yes, the formation of hydrocarbons other than C6 isomers at 400 °C in the presence of La-BTTc is indicative of cracking reaction capabilities similar to zeolites.
